title: Cannot connect to login queue!
body: It has been over a week since I have been able to log into league of legends. Each time that I try I get the immediate message telling me that I am unable to connect to the login queue. I have tried every one of the few recommended fixes, including re-syncing my clock, changing regions, checking firewall, dns, antivirus programs, and everything listed in riot's guide. The problem began with the retiring of the legacy client, for weeks I had used that to play league, although not without its own issues. With the legacy client I was able to login In, but never able to connect to the chat servers. So no inviting friends and no chatting with them either. Even at this point I was not able to login to the beta client, and now with beta being the only option, I am, as you would say "screwed". If anyone could help me I would be very appreciative, I have tried using the hextech repair and reinstalling, all to no avail.

replies.body:
It sounds like your network settings are off, so now you're unable to prevent to either the login queue probably pvp.net as well.  I see you ran a few steps which is good, but it's important to run through every step in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to rule out possibilities.

Otherwise, grab the logs provided by the HRT and attach it to a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Our tech team will work with you individually to figure this out!
